Either is a dependable choice.The one thing I will say is that while you can play outdoors here and there with this, it's not great if you play all the time. It will last a decent amount of time, but the real problem is the composite leather. It by nature picks up more dirt and dust from the courts than other materials. Definitely bring a towel to keep wiping this off.So to recap: great all purpose ball with durability at a great price point. But material composition means that other brands that have rubber leather hybrids will be better choices if you tend to play more on outdoor courts than indoor courts.  If you play more on indoor courts and occasionally at the park, then this should be your everyday ball (or the other Spalding ball depending of feel/preference)
